title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled when they don't have any effect on the image.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2 and KDE 2.2, the scrollbars are enabled. It is possible to move them around, but they do not have any effect on the image. When opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are misleading because they do not do anything.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to avoid confusion when they don't have any effect on the image.
SR:
1. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
2. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled.
3. Attempt to move the scrollbars and notice that they don't have any effect on the image.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are still enabled and misleading.
